text.text_translated: Lewis would like to increase the number of protected areas in the sea from 3 to 10 per cent, because he wants to fix the damage that is caused by human activities like overfishing, pollution and leaving rubbish. During his journeys, Lewis has seen this damage to nature with his own eyes. He has swum over coral reefs, which are underwater structures made by small animals, that have turned white because the water is warmer. He has also seen underwater deserts in the Red Sea which have no life and are covered in plastic. Pugh believes that nature can get better if we give it the space to do so, but he thinks we are running out of time. If we don't start taking care of our seas, we may soon have a problem that is impossible to solve.

The final text is clear, fluent, and perfectly suited for a B1 audience.
